Class Table

java.lang.Object
project.Table
public class Table extends Object
Represents a table in the database, consisting of a name, a list of columns, and a list of rows.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Table(String name, List<Column> columns)
    Constructs a new Table with a name and a list of columns.
    Table(String name, List<Column> columns, List<Row> rows)
    Constructs a new Table with a name, a list of columns, and an initial list of rows.

  • Constructor Details

    • Table

      public Table(String name, List<Column> columns)
      Constructs a new Table with a name and a list of columns. Initializes an empty list of rows.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the table. Cannot be null or empty.
      columns - The list of Column objects defining the table structure. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If name or columns list is null/empty.

    • Table

      public Table(String name, List<Column> columns, List<Row> rows)
      Constructs a new Table with a name, a list of columns, and an initial list of rows.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the table. Cannot be null or empty.
      columns - The list of Column objects. Cannot be null.
      rows - The list of Row objects. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If name, columns, or rows list is null/empty where not allowed.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of the table.
      Returns:
      The table name.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the table.
      Parameters:
      name - The new name for the table. Cannot be null or empty.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided name is null or empty.

    • getColumns

      public List<Column> getColumns()
      Gets a copy of the list of columns in this table.
      Returns:
      A new list containing the Column objects. Modifying this list will not affect the table.

    • getRows

      public List<Row> getRows()
      Gets a copy of the list of rows in this table.
      Returns:
      A new list containing the Row objects. Modifying this list will not affect the table.

    • getRow

      public Row getRow(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Retrieves a specific row from the table by its index.
      Parameters:
      index - The zero-based index of the row.
      Returns:
      The Row object at the specified index.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of range.

    • setRows

      public void setRows(List<Row> newRows)
      Replaces all rows in the table with a new list of rows.
      Parameters:
      newRows - The new list of Row objects. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If newRows is null.

    • getColumn

      public Column getColumn(int index) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Retrieves a specific column definition from the table by its index.
      Parameters:
      index - The zero-based index of the column.
      Returns:
      The Column object at the specified index.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If the index is out of range for the columns.

    • getColumnIndex

      public int getColumnIndex(String columnName) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Finds the index of a column by its name (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      columnName - The name of the column to find.
      Returns:
      The zero-based index of the column.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If the column with the given name is not found.

    • addRow

      public void addRow(Row row) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Adds a new row to the table. The number of values in the row must match the number of columns in the table.
      Parameters:
      row - The Row object to add.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If the row's size does not match the table's column count.

    • addColumn

      public void addColumn(Column column) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Adds a new column to the table definition. All existing rows will be extended with a null value for this new column.
      Parameters:
      column - The Column object to add.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If a column with the same name already exists (case-insensitive).

    • removeRow

      public boolean removeRow(Row row)
      Removes a specific row from the table.
      Parameters:
      row - The Row object to remove.
      Returns:
      True if the row was found and removed, false otherwise.
